member.name: T:Turning.TTResponseSources.My.Resources.Resources

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.HIDDevices.Shutdown
member.summary: This method closes all open connections and removes references to all attached receivers.
member.remarks: This method should be called prior to exiting the parent application.

member.name: E:Turning.TTResponseSources.RIDevices.Response
member.summary: Once a Poll is started all responses from attached receivers are accessed from this event.
member.param: Contains the identification value for the receiver the current response was collected from.
Contains the identification value for the ResponseCard the current response originated from.
The current response value the user selected.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.RIDevices.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Poll class with the specified company name and license key.
member.remarks: If a valid company name and license key is not entered the object will fail to load.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.RIDevices.Refresh
member.summary: Forces the Poll object to search for any receiver changes.
member.remarks: If a receiver is added or removed this method can be called to discover changes. If a poll has been started this method will end it.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.RIDevices.StartPolling
member.summary: This method will start polling on all attached receivers.
member.remarks: Once a poll has been started reponses can be received through the Response event.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.RIDevices.EndPolling
member.summary: This method will end polling on all attached receivers.
member.remarks: Once a poll has ended responses will no longer be collected until StartPoll is called again.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.RIDevices.Shutdown
member.summary: This method closes all open connections and removes references to all attached receivers.
member.remarks: This method should be called prior to exiting the parent application.

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.RIDevices.ReceiverCount
member.summary: Gets the number of receivers currently initialized.
member.returns: The total number of receivers attached and initialized.
member.remarks: If no receivers are attached or a valid company name and license key is not present ReceiverCount will be zero.

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.ObtainKey
member.summary: Function to obtain a Hexidecimal Key to be Encrypted to verify a Proper License

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.Create(System.String,Turning.TTResponseSources.ITTResponseSourceSettings,System.ComponentModel.ISynchronizeInvoke,System.Collections.Generic.SortedList{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Shared Function to Create a new TPResponseSource Object
member.param: Base64 Encryption of the Key returned by ObtainKey
Windows Control object used to Syncronize Events on the main thread
member.returns: Nothing if the Create Fails, the new Object if the Create Succeeds

member.name: E:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.NewResponse
member.summary: Event Triggered each time a New Response is received
member.param: Either 'Simulated', 'RWHost, or the Serial Number of the Receiver
DeviceID that generated the Response
The Response generated

member.name: E:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.ClearResponse
member.summary: Event Triggered each time a Response is cleared
member.param: DeviceID that generated the Response

member.name: E:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.Disconnection
member.summary: Used by ResponseWare Web to indicate a Device has disconnected. Useful for freeing up Capacity.
member.param: Should be 'RWHost'
Device ID of the Device attempting to connect

member.name: E:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.WarningMessage
member.summary: Event Triggered when an event occurs that is unexpected but was handled by code.

member.name: E:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Event Triggered when an event occurs that breaks functionality of the Object
member.param: Enumerated value indicating the error that occured

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.Title
member.summary: Usually the Text of the Question

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.Message
member.summary: Body of the Message when Displaying a Message in ResponseWare Web

member.name: F:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.Answers
member.summary: An Array of the text of the Answers

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.BulletStyle
member.summary: Value indicating which of the Supported Bullets types should be displayed in ResponseWare Web

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.ResponseLength
member.summary: Used to indicate the Number of Responses allowed for MultiResponse Slides

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.QuestionGUID
member.summary: 'Used to identify question for RemotePoll

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.QuestionType
member.summary: Used to identify question type for RemotePoll

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.CurrentQuestion
member.summary: Used to store currently polling question

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.ChannelManager
member.summary: Method to return an Instance of the TPChannelManager Object

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.PresenterWare
member.summary: Method to return an Instance of the TTPresenterWare Object

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.InvalidResponseNotification
member.summary: True indicates that RI Devices will only blink Green for Valid Responses

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.AcceptUserData
member.summary: True indicates that the Devices should accept and/or Prompt for User Information, False tells the Object to ignore any incoming UserInformation

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.EnforceParticipantList
member.summary: True indicates the system should limit Responses to those users already in the Participant List; false indicates that all users should be allowed to respond.

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.PollTest
member.summary: True if the System currently has Polling Test open, False otherwise

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.WorkerNeedsUpdated
member.summary: Flag to that determines whether to look for new devices.

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.IsPolling
member.summary: True if the System is Currently Polling, False otherwise

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.PollingMode
member.summary: Return a value indicated what the Current Polling State is of the Object

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.SimulateCount
member.summary: Count of the number of Devices to Simulate with if a Participant List is not used.

member.name: P:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.UseSimulated
member.summary: True tells the system to use Simulated data instead of actual Responses, False tells the system to use real data.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.StartPolling(Turning.TTSessionLibrary.ITTQuestion,System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Starts Polling on any Devices selected, or with Simulated Data if specified
member.param: question object from which to set polling properties. Must be build for PollingObjects.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.GenerateRWQuestion(Turning.TTSessionLibrary.ITTQuestion,System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: GenerateRWQuestion makes a RWQuestion object to send in an atmosphere message.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.EndPolling(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Ends Polling on any Devices Selected, will trigger Response Events from ResponseWare Web before completing
member.param: This is used to tell ResponseWare whether to enter review mode (false) or just close polling (true).
This is used to prevent the Self-Paced environment from affecting ResponseWare.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.ShowResults(Turning.TTSessionLibrary.TTResults,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Int32}})
member.summary: Used to send a ShowResults message through ResponseWare
member.param: the results
What to divide by to figure percentage
Whether to show percentage
What colors for the bars in the chart. There should be the same number of these as there are results and in desired order.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTResponseSource.CheckResponseWareUserData(System.String)
member.summary: CheckResponseWareUserData will check if there is unsubmitted user data for the given device id and if there is it will submit it.

member.name: E:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTSimulated.Response
member.summary: Once a Poll is started all responses from attached receivers are accessed from this event.
member.param: Contains the identification value for the receiver the current response was collected from.
Contains the identification value for the ResponseCard the current response originated from.
The current response value the user selected.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTSimulated.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Poll class with the specified company name and license key.
member.remarks: If a valid company name and license key is not entered the object will fail to load.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTSimulated.Refresh
member.summary: Forces the Poll object to search for any receiver changes.
member.remarks: If a receiver is added or removed this method can be called to discover changes. If a poll has been started this method will end it.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTSimulated.EndPolling
member.summary: This method will end polling on all attached receivers.
member.remarks: Once a poll has ended responses will no longer be collected until StartPoll is called again.

member.name: M:Turning.TTResponseSources.TTSimulated.Shutdown
member.summary: This method closes all open connections and removes references to all attached receivers.
member.remarks: This method should be called prior to exiting the parent application.
